document.docAuthor: Jerinić-Prodanović, Dušanka, Mihajlović, Ljubodrag & Stojanović, Aleksandar
document.masterDocTitle: Parasitoids of jumping plant-lice (Psylloidea, Hemiptera) from the family Encyrtidae (Hymenoptera, Chalcidoidea) in Serbia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Parasitoids of jumping plant-lice (Psylloidea, Hemiptera) from the family Encyrtidae (Hymenoptera, Chalcidoidea) in Serbia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Cacopsylla bidens
, from
Pyrus communis , Ilinci
, 08.vi.2008 . ex pupa 1♀ , Zemun-Fakultet, 15.vii.2009 . ex pupa 18.vii.2009 1♀ , 22.vii.2010 . ex pupa 26.vii.2010 . 2 ♀ , 22.vi.2015 ex pupa 4♀♀ 5♂♂ .
Cacopsylla breviantennata (Flor)
from
Sorbus aria (Linnaeus)
, Tara, Predov krst, 25.9.2007 . ex pupa 2♀♀ .
Cacopsylla pyri
from
Pyrus communis , Radmilovac
, 12.vi.2006 . ex pupa 16.vi.2006 . 1♀ ; 26.vi.2006 . ex pupa 30.vi.2006 . 9♀♀ , 10.vii.2006 . ex pupa 15.vii.2006 . 1♀ 1♂ , 26.vii.2006 . ex pupa 28.vii.2006 . 1♂ , 04.ix.2006 . ex pupa 3♀♀ , 26.x.2006 . ex pupa 1♀ , 15.xi.2006 . ex pupa 1♀ , 18.xi.2006 . ex pupa 30.xi.2006 . 8♀♀ , 07.ix.2008 . ex pupa 2♂♂ . Radmilovac, 20.vi.2012 . ex pupa 27.vi.2012 . 1♀ .

TABLE 2. Summary of species of Encyrtidae and their psyllid hosts with host plant associations. (*), new psyllid host, ( ► ), new record of parasitoid species in Serbia.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Hosts . Psyllidae (
Cacopsylla
sp.,
C. pyri , C. pyricola , C. pyrisuga
), Encyrtidae (
Syrphophagus mamitus
) ( Trjapitzin 1989 ; Noyes 2017).

Diagnosis. Body dark brown with shiny dark reflections on mesoscutum. Scutellum bright, metallic blue or green sheen. Top of scape and top of pedicel paler than other parts, legs brown, distal third of mesotibia and tarsi pale yellow. The specimens are in accordance to the description by Trjapitzin (1989) (as
Trechnites psyllae (Ruschka)
and Guerrieri & Noyes (2009) .

Comments. Recorded on
Cacopsylla pyri
in Serbia (
Grbić et al . 1989
. Guerrieri and Noyes 2009 ).

Here
Trechnites insidiosus
is recorded in association with
C. breviantennata
for the first time ( Table 2 ).
